required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: S100B Protein and Postoperative Cognitive Dysfunction
clinical_study.official_title: S100B Protein as Predictor of Cognitive Dysfunction After Robot-assisted Radical Prostatectomy: A Prospective Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: Primary aim of this study is to evaluate the association between postoperative cognitive dysfunction and increased serum levels of S100B protein after robot-assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy.

detailed_description.textblock:
The neurocognitive assessment protocol will design to evaluate general cognitive function and identify patients with cognitive dysfunction. Neuropsychological tests of all patients will conduct on the one day prior to surgery, the first day after surgery, and the 30 th day after surgery, respectively. According to a consensus statement, cognitive function will assess using a battery of seven neuropsychological tests: Rey Auditory Verbal Learning Test (delayed recall), Trail Making Test (Parts A and B), Digit Span Test (forward and backward), and Grooved Pegboard Test (dominant and non-dominant hands). Postoperative cognitive dysfunction (POCD) was defined as a decline of >20% from preoperative test scores in at least two of seven tests.
Serum levels of S100B protein will obtain from venous blood samples collected before surgery, after the anesthesia induction, immediately after surgery and 24 h postoperatively.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from neuropsychological test scores at 30 days.
primary_outcome.description: This assessment will be applied before surgery, and 1 and 30 days after surgery.

intervention.description: Neuropsychological tests of all patients will conduct on the one day prior to surgery, the first day after surgery, and the 30 th day after surgery

study_pop.textblock: Adults between 50 and 90 years of age with robot assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy , were selected in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- over 50 years old
- scheduled for robotic-assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy
- the body mass index ranged from 18 kg/m2 to 25 kg/m2
- American Society of Anesthesiologists class I, II or III
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with previous neurological deficit (symptomatic stroke, hemorrhage, transient ischemic attack)
- other neurologic disorders (epilepsy, trauma, intra- or extracranial malignancy)
- psychiatric diseases (schizophrenia, or depressive disorder)
- alcoholism or any other drug dependence
- serious hearing or visual impairment

facility.name: Antalya Training and Research Hospital, Department of Anesthesiology and Reanimation
